title: Safe Mammal Hunting Precautions
brief: Understand the risks and precautions when hunting mammals for food.
steps: Step 1: Remember that all mammals have teeth and will bite in self-defense - even squirrels can inflict serious wounds.
Step 2: Avoid polar bear and bearded seal livers completely - they contain toxic levels of vitamin A.
Step 3: Stay away from platypus (Australia/Tasmania) - they have poisonous glands.
Step 4: Exercise caution with scavenging mammals like opossums as they may carry diseases.
Step 5: Be extremely careful around mother animals defending their young.
Step 6: Never corner an animal with no escape route - they will fight viciously when trapped.
warnings: Any mammal bite presents serious risk of infection.
Mother animals are extremely aggressive when protecting young.
Polar bear and bearded seal liver toxicity can be fatal.
Cornered animals fight with maximum desperation and strength.
